title: Nheer
author: Nheer
content: In my study to know more about bitcoin I discovered that difficulty is a measure of the complexity of finding a hash below a given target or the difficulty of mining a Bitcoin block. But I still have problem understanding and I need further clarification about How blocks of difficulty are stored? And What is the frequency of network difficulty changes?

comments.author: tromp
comments.body: Quote from: Nheer on March 11, 2023, 08:54:28 PMIn my study to know more about bitcoin I discovered that difficulty is a measure of the complexity of finding a hash below a given target or the difficulty of mining a Bitcoin block. But I still have problem understanding and I need further clarification about How blocks of difficulty are stored? And What is the frequency of network difficulty changes?You should find all your questions answered at https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/DifficultyIn short: difficulty is stored (in compressed form) in header field "bits" and difficulty adjusts every 2016 blocks.

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: Quote from: tromp on March 11, 2023, 08:58:44 PMQuote from: Nheer on March 11, 2023, 08:54:28 PMIn my study to know more about bitcoin I discovered that difficulty is a measure of the complexity of finding a hash below a given target or the difficulty of mining a Bitcoin block. But I still have problem understanding and I need further clarification about How blocks of difficulty are stored? And What is the frequency of network difficulty changes?You should find all your questions answered at https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/DifficultyIn short: difficulty is stored (in compressed form) in header field "bits" and difficulty adjusts every 2016 blocks.More precisely, the target is stored in the nBits field in the header. The difficulty is a value that is computed from the target.

comments.body: Bitcoin network difficulty will be re-targeted each 2016 blocks.Bitcoin Difficulty Estimator gives you estimation for a next difficulty change.
